pr_title: cutelyst: Update to newer version, add async SQL, use Cutelee templating

timeline.message: cutelyst: Update to newer version, add async SQL, use Cutelee templating

timeline.bodyText:
Should be selecting id and randomNumber from the db on each query
Edit: Looks like you did it on the others, but just missed this one
timeline.author: nbrady-techempower

replies.bodyText: Well I re-read the requirements and was unsure if that was needed, after all the where is already selecting the id, if it ok if I do select id, random from... but doesn't use the id from the query?
replies.author: dantti

replies.bodyText: What I mean is that as you can see I'm building the json before because I already know how it's going to be, doesn't make much sense to build it later.
replies.author: dantti

replies.bodyText:
where is already selecting the id

What we mean by selecting the id is that it will be returned from the database. Without the id in the select clause, fewer bytes are returned:
hello_world=# select randomNumber from world where id=1;
 randomnumber
--------------
         5703
(1 row)

hello_world=# select id, randomNumber from world where id=1;
 id | randomnumber
----+--------------
  1 |         5703
(1 row)
replies.author: nbrady-techempower

replies.bodyText:
Ok, look:
At least the randomNumber field must be read from the database result set.
That's on the wiki requirements page, so I'm ok right?
replies.author: dantti

replies.bodyText:
No. That is "read from the result set" meaning you must access that field of the object that's returned from the database.

Each row must be selected randomly using one query in the same fashion as the single database query test.

And then from the single database query test:


For every request, a single row from a World table must be retrieved from a database table. It is not acceptable to read just the randomNumber.
replies.author: nbrady-techempower

replies.bodyText:
If you feel like this is unclear, that is fine. I will update all of the rules to make it clearer that is not acceptable to read just the randomNumber field from the World table for any of the database query / update tests.
Edit: Updated the wiki
replies.author: nbrady-techempower

replies.bodyText:
No. That is "read from the result set" meaning you must access that field of the object that's returned from the database.

hmm how should I "access" it, because if I don't have an use for it the compiler will simply optimize the code and remove the retrieval.
replies.author: dantti

replies.bodyText: The compiler is smart enough to remove the "id" from the prepared select statement? that's impressive, if that's what's happening. this is fine for now, but something i'd be interested in looking into further at some point.
replies.author: nbrady-techempower

replies.bodyText: Nope, what I was saying was about the access the current random number returned by the database.
replies.author: dantti

timeline.message: cutelyst: include id column on updates test
